channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2024030730
item.description:
Report X-2024030730

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WET FIBERBOARD BOX WAS DISCOVERED IN THE QA AREA, CONTAINS 2 PLASTIC BOTTLES WITH METHANOL FLAMMBLE LIQUID WITH LOOSE CAP. ISF WAS DONE, DPR WAS DONE AND THE PACKAGE WAS CODED 105. OP-951 REPORT WAS DONE ALSO THE HESS REPORT. PACKAGE IS NOW WAITING ON DISPOSITION IN A HAZMAT BIN LOCKED AWAY IN THE HAZARDOUS CAGE. DescribePack: LOOSE CAP. CAP WAS NOT TIGHTLY CLOSED DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: N/A

item.title: Report X-2024030788
item.description:
Report X-2024030788

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: IT APPEARS THE SHIPMENT WAS REMOVED FROM THE SYSTEM FLOW, DUE TO THE EXTERNAL CARTON BEING TORN AND WET DURING THE DAY SORT DescribePack: UPON INSPECTION IT WAS DISCOVERED TWO PLASTIC JERRICAN OF HERCULES ADVANCED UN 2735 AMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S 2.5 X 2 GALLONS. ONE BOTTLE HAD A PUNCTURE IN THE BODY OF THE CONTAINER AND CAUSED LEAKAGING ALLOWING 20% SPILLAGE. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: FACILITY PROCEDURES FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIAL FOLLOWED, CONTENTS CONTAINED AND AWAITING DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024030925
item.description:
Report X-2024030925

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030925 SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during sunrise sort in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection showed package to be wet with internal leakage, and 1 of 4 items with a loose cap. Damage most likely caused from being placed on wrong conveyor belt. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated. 2. X-2024030972 SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during the sunrise sort in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection showed package to be wet with internal leakage, torn open, and 1 of 4 had a loose cap. Damage most likely caused from being placed on wrong coveyor belt. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2024030945
item.description:
Report X-2024030945

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. ONE BOTTLE OF FOUR ADVANAGE CHEMICALS DELIMER WAS FOUND TO BE 10% LEAKING. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF ADVANAGE CHEMICALS DELIMER CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE, UPON INSPECTION 2 BOTTLES OF 4 WAS MISSING (PART B). PART A RAPICIDE HAS NO VISIBLE DAMAGE, THEY WERE PLACE IN A LINE SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF THE RAPICIDE CAUSE FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINE SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024030712
item.description:
Report X-2024030712

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: DAYTON
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE UNLOADING, PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED A POWDER WAS LEAKING FROM PACKAGE, PLACE IT IN A DAMAGED HAZMAT TOTE, AND GAVE TO QA FOR FURTHER INSPECTION. DescribePack: BOTTOM OF THE CALCIUM HYPOCHLORITE GALLON JUG CRACKED, CAUSING POWDER TO LEAK FROM PACKAGE. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA PLACED PRODUCT IN A LINED YELLOW DRUM AND PLACED DRUM IN HAZMAT CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024030743
item.description:
Report X-2024030743

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: WAYNE
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler unloaded the package, noticed a bad smell coming from package and the outside was discolored. They brought the package to QA attention. Upon inspection QA noticed the cap was leaking. DescribePack: Liquid leaking from underneath cap with no visible breaks or cracks. Continues leaking after tightening. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in hazmat tub and relocated to ventilated area in the back of the building

item.description:
Report X-2024030933

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE LOOSE LABEL WAS LEFT ON THE HAZMAT CART. UPON INSEPECTION THE LABEL OF CALIUM HYOPCLHRITE, HYDRATED MIXTURES WAS THE ONLY PRESENT. THE CONTENTS WERE MISSING HENCE THE PACKAGE WILL BE SCRAPPED. DescribePack: FAILURE OFF CALIUM HYOPCLHRITE, HYDRATED MIXTURES COULD CAUSE FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: THE LABEL WAS PLACED INSIDE THE HAZMAT CAGE TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2024030547
item.description:
Report X-2024030547

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-02
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 2nd a package was discovered during the PM sort that was stained on the outside indicating a leak. Further investigation shows that the package contained several items one of which was a bottle that fully leaked and shows UN1170 Ethanol, 3, PGII. The package did not show any indication of dangerous goods inside the package. The package was placed into a salvage drum and is being held pending disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024030676
item.description:
Report X-2024030676

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-18
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 3/17/2024 at approximately 2115, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 435751 at the ramp facilty in Newark, reportting an alcohol spill. This shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing two plastic jugs. One of the jugs had a warped closure, rtesulting in spillage. The cause of the damage is unknown. The shipment was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2024030331
item.description:
Report X-2024030331

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-19T15:11:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024030331 SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE BOTTLE OF ZEP MORADO SUPER CLEANER WAS FOUND TO LEAKING. IT HAS APPOROXIMATELY 15% OF LEAKAGE. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURN TO THE SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF ZEP MORADO SUPER CLEANER CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION. 2. X-2024030332 SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION TWO BOTTLES OF ZEP INDUSTRIAL PURPLE DEGREASER WAS FOUND TO BE MISSING AND ONE SLIGHTLY LEAKING. THE REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURNED TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF ZEP INDUSTRIAL PURPLE DEGREASER CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report E-2024030426
item.description:
Report E-2024030426

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-21
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO Logistics
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately one (1) cup of V705-D was released from two (2) boxes containing six (6) 750ml poly cartridges each. The boxes were crushed by freight loaded on top of the boxes. The spilled content was contained inside the boxes. ERTS reviewed the SDS and PPE requirements for the material with the caller and determined the terminal would clean the spill, the waste was containerized into one 20-gallon poly drum.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: When unloading freight from trailer material handler discover a pail that was slightly leaking from being struck by a forklift forkblade when it was originally loaded. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.
